> - How is the correct way to add a link in an extractor processor?

For extractors, the correct way is to add the link to the CrawlURI 
passed to the processor.  First construct the Link object, then use the 
CrawlURI.addOutLink method to add the link.


> - What are context and hopType for?

Reporting, I believe.  The context should be the URI where the new link 
was discovered.  The hopType just tells what kind of link it was. 
During long crawls, an operator can use this information to trace 
difficult URIs to their source, for instance.


> - Is it correct to add a CandidateURI instead a Link in an extractor
> (with replaceOutLinks)? If not, why? If yes, should them be created
> with createCandidateURI, or with its constructors (creating an UURI
> first)?

Here I'm not sure; perhaps someone else on the list can answer this?


> Where can I find such information? Is there a document where is
> explained how links are added, when are transformed, what is context
> and hopType, etc?

I'm afraid not.  This list is probably your best bet for now.
